fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to access a restricted page without being logged in
# You receive a 'Something went wrong. Refresh the page and try again. If this keeps happening, let us know using the link below. Visit Atlassian Support'

The message is clearing sending the wrong message to our customers since the problem will be solved if customers simply login.

h3. Expected Results
Update the error message to something like 'You're not logged in for now. Please login first and let us know using the link below if the problem persists. Visit Atlassian Support'
fields.summary: Improve the error message for not logged in users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As far as it is understood in [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/questionscloud/permissions-738361787.html], questions and their answers should obey the space permissions which the questions are, but if a user/group has the *view* permission on the space, it is enough to get the answers and the questions deleted.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure you have [Questions for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1211644/questions-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] installed on your site;
# Using your main user, create a question on a space;
# Change the space permissions to the *confluence-users* group allowing only the *view* one;
# Using a different user that is a member of only *confluence-users*, access this space and go to the questions.

h3. Expected Results
The second user is only able to see the question and its answers

h3. Actual Results
The second user can delete the questions and its answers.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Questions for Confluence: questions can be deleted by anyone with access to the space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
UI/UX bug
When overing the padlock icon on a page with edit restrictions only, the alt text will say "No restrictions", causing confusion to users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a page on view mode and click on the padlock (restrictions) icon
# Set an edit restriction
# Apply
# On view mode again, hover the padlock icon

h3. Expected Results
It should say "Restrictions Apply"

h3. Actual Results
It says "No restrictions"

h3. Workaround
Click on the padlock to check if the page has edit restrictions.
fields.summary: Hovering the padlock icon on a page with edit restriction will display "No restrictions"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
 * Currently, there isn't a way to disable Workbox notifications:
 !Screenshot 2019-10-23 at 09.42.58.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screenshot 2019-10-23 at 09.42.35.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
 * Allow individual users to enable/disable the Workbox notifications
 * Allo admins to enforce notification settings

h3. Why this is important
 * Some customers may not want to receive Workbox notifications
 * It's possible to [disable the Workbox notifications on Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-workbox-notifications-301663830.html#ConfiguringWorkboxNotifications-Disablingworkboxandin-appnotificationsinConfluence], but not Cloud

h3. Workaround
 * None
fields.summary: Disable Workbox notifications

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
For tables in the old editor, the table header configured in the edit mode is not being fixed consistently when viewing the table in the view mode. Sometimes, the header gets fixed, but if you refresh the page, it is scrolled with the table content. 

h3. Environment
* Old editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with a scrollable table in the old editor and set a header for it (choose either fixed width or responsive);
# Publish the page and check if the header is fixed. 

h3. Expected Results
The table header should be fixed everytime you access, publish or refresh the page. 

h3. Actual Results
The table header is not consistently fixed. Sometimes it is, sometimes it is scrolled with the table content. 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The fixed headers are not working consistently for fixed-width/responsive tables in the old editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Nested tables are no longer supported, but old pages with it are still preserved and it's possible to copy them onto new pages using the legacy editor.

The problem occurs when there's a huge amount of those tables (tested with around 2000 nested tables - a single table inside of a single table, one below the other, 2000 times). This page will not be editable.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a page with nested tables
 # Copy the table
 # Paste it more than 2000 times on a new page using the legacy editor.

h3. Expected Results

The page should be published
h3. Actual Results

The page can't be published, with the following errors being shown:
{quote}It's taking longer than usual to load this page. Give it a few moments, then try reloading. If it still doesn't load, speak to your Confluence admin.
{quote}
{quote}Unable to communicate with server. Saving is not possible at the moment.
{quote}
h3. Workaround

Manually transform the nested tables into normal tables by moving the inner table to be outside of the outer one.
fields.summary: It's possible to create a page with multiple nested tables and break the editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, if the user access the *System apps* part of the *Manage Apps* section, and then, tap *Configure*, a message that "this is a restricted page" will be displayed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Select * Manage apps*
# On the drop-down for the add-on type, select  *System*
# Search for the *Office Connector plugin* and tap *Configure*

h3. Expected Results
The button should not be displayed, or, provide a different message when tapped.

h3. Actual Results
"This is a restricted page" message is displayed.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Tapping the "Configure" button on the System "Office Connector" App gives a "restricted page" message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This bug impacts all of confluence pages that have Gliffy Diagrams and JIRA issue macros in the same page using tiny editor. 

When you click to edit an existing diagram, you are unable to do anything on the diagram itself. Cannot add shapes, edit existing shapes, click/drag the screen or add any text. It looks like there is an overlay, or the screen is frozen. 

Unable to open an existing diagram to edit when launching from within the Confluence page edit mode. When you click to edit a confluence page, click the Gliffy diagram, and click edit, it is launched to a grey screen and it stops there.
h3. Environment

Tiny editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in tiny editor
 # Add JIRA issue and Gliffy macro on it
# Save
# Edit the Gliffy diagram
# Edit the confluence page and edit the Gliffy diagram
# Publish

h3. Expected Results
Both methods of editing and you are able to make changes in the Gliffy diagram and publish the page
h3. Actual Results
Editing the Gliffy diagram is not possible, unable to drag and drop, add shapes or text.
Editing while in edit page mode and then clicking on edit Gliffy diagram redirects to a grey screen and it never loads.

h3. Notes
It works normally if there is no JIRA issue macros in the page (tiny editor).
h3. Workaround

Currently, the workaround was to reload the page when the bug happens, but it works intermittently.
fields.summary: Cannot Edit Gliffy Diagrams if there is a Jira Issue Macro on the same page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When clicking on a mentioned user inside Questions for Confluence, instead of showing the user profile, the page is throwing a 404 error page:

!Screen Shot 2019-10-22 at 10.59.11.png|width=400!
h3. Environment
 * Questions for Confluence

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a question in Questions for Confluence where a user was mentioned or mention any user in a question/answer;
 # Click on the mentioned user to open the profile and see the dead link page

It was reproduced in two test instances and we noticed that the link is a little bit strange. It is appending the instance URL twice: [*https://transylvania.atlassian.net*/{color:#de350b}https://transylvania.atlassian.net/{color}wiki/people/5d0c5e02c184b50c22ff2ee4%3Fref=confluence]
h3. Expected Results

The mentioned user profile should be opened
h3. Actual Results

The 404 dead page error is showing up.
h3. Workaround

Access the user profile manually:
 # From the sidebar, click on the Search button;
 # Scroll down the sidebar and click on the "Search People" button;
 # Search the user.
fields.summary: Clicking on a mentioned user in Questions for Confluence results in a dead link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you insert the activity stream macro, if you select the space and JIRA issue key in the global filter, after saving changes, the activity stream show the message: No activity was found.
 It happens independent if you are saving with the save button inside the macro to save the filters or the save button to save the edit changes of the macro.
h3. Environment

Fabric
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an activity stream macro in any page
 # Selected in the global filters the space filter is *space test* (any space test in instance)
 # JIRA issue Key filter is *key project* (any existing key project)
 # Save the configuration on the Save Button under the Display Option for the activity stream macro
 # Save in the save button of the activity stream macro

h3. Expected Results

It loads the activities for the JIRA issues in the space as well.
h3. Actual Results

No activity was found.
h3. Notes

Available Streams Jira - JIRA and System JIRA - JIRA add filter button is not working to add filter too.

The Activity Stream macro works normally if you only use the space filter.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Activity Stream Macro is not working with JIRA issues key filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While creating content on a page using the new editor, if you hit the *TAB* keyboard key to ident a header and its below text/content, the next time you use it on a new header right below the current one will lose the formatting in the published mode.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* New Editing Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page;
# Hit the *TAB* key;
# Add a header title and hit *ENTER*;
# Start to type some text;
# Hit *ENTER* and then *TAB* again;
# Insert another header title and hit *ENTER*;
# Type some text and publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
The formatting is the same as in the editing mode, where we have a space between the first paragraph and the net header.

h3. Actual Results
The formatting is lost and the second header is right after the first paragraph.

h3. Notes
Watch this video to understand a bit more of this issue:
 [^How-to - CONFCLOUD-68255.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Indenting headers with TAB doesn't respect the formatting in the published mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you added a Wiki macro (Markdown format) to a page using the old editor, you can no longer add Wiki macro on any other pages that uses old editor. 

h3. Environment

Pages that uses old editor (TinyMCE)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create/Edit a page that uses old editor
 # Add a Wiki macro
 # Switch to "Markdown" format and add something like {{\*test\*}} which should be rendered as _test_ in Markdown but will be shown as *test* (a different bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-65842)
 # Try to add another Wiki macro, no popup dialog will appear

h3. Expected Results

* Able to add more Wiki macro

h3. Actual Results

* Nothing happens

The below exception is thrown in the browser console:
{noformat}
Uncaught SyntaxError: Unexpected token M in JSON at position 0
    at Object.parse (<anonymous>)
    at Object.get (persistent-storage.js:29)
    at An (editor_plugin_src.js:97)
    at tw.<anonymous> (editor_plugin_src.js:387)
    at i.exec.<computed> (atlassian-editor.min.js:1)
    at T.execCommand (atlassian-editor.min.js:1)
    at tw.execCommand (atlassian-editor.min.js:12)
    at tw.b [as execCommand] (batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-GB:508)
    at adg3-plugin.js:160
    at HTMLLIElement.<anonymous> (adg3-plugin.js:441)
{noformat}

h3. Notes

* Once the error is triggered, you can no longer add Wiki macro in any old editor pages regardless if the page in question has an existing Wiki macro

h3. Workaround

* Use the new editor (if possible) as it [supports Markdown natively|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html#ConfluenceEditingImprovements-Updatedkeyboardshortcuts,autocomplete,andfullMarkdownsupport]
* Do not use the "Markdown" format when adding the Wiki macro.
* If you already run into this issue, you can clear your browser's local storage for the site. Then you should be able to add Wiki macro again. Just be sure to add it in the "Confluence Site" format to not trigger this bug again.

Steps to clear local storage for your Confluence site:
* Google Chrome:
# While on a page in your Confluence site, open the Developer tools ({{Option+Cmd+i}} in Mac or {{Ctrl+Shift+i}} in Windows/Linux)
# Switch to the Application tab
# On the left bar, under "Local storage", expand it and you should see your Confluence site URL like {{https://an-example.atlassian.net}}
# Right click it and choose clear
# You should be able to add the Wiki macro again

* Mozilla Firefox:
# While on a page in your Confluence site, open the Developer tools ({{Option+Cmd+i}} in Mac or {{Ctrl+Shift+i}} in Windows/Linux)
# Switch to the Storage tab
# On the left bar, under "Local Storage", expand it and you should see your Confluence site URL like {{https://an-example.atlassian.net}}
# Right click it and choose clear
# You should be able to add the Wiki macro again

* Apple Safari:
# While on a page in your Confluence site, open the Developer tools ({{Option+Cmd+i}})
# Switch to the Console tab
# Run {{localStorage.clear()}} in the browser console at the bottom of the page (looks like a line that only shows {{>}})
# You should be able to add the Wiki macro again
fields.summary: Unable to add Wiki macro in pages with old editor

In Confluence, if the user unchecks the checkbox for *Show option panel when text is selected* in order to disable the pop-ups for Inline comments and Jira issues macro, it will not work/will not disable such features.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# There, make sure to *edit* the details and *uncheck* the *Text select* checkbox.
# *Save* the configuration
# Go to a page and highlight text

h3. Expected Results
No pop-ups should be displayed when highlighting the text.

h3. Actual Results
The pop-ups are still displayed.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, with the Legacy editor, if the user highlights a text equal to what is also included as a title for an expand macro, the following message will be displayed:

{quote}
We can't add your inline comment; the section you highlighted may contain a macro or user mention. Try highlighting plain text.
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page and add a text to it (in our example, we will use "example test")
# Add an [Expand macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/expand-macro-724765195.html] and have a title equal to the previously added text ("example test"). Note, note the text on the body of the macro, but, the title/clickable link to expand it.
# Publish the page
# Highlight the text and tap the pop-up to create an inline text

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to create an Inline text

h3. Actual Results
A message is displayed and the inline comment is not added.

h3.Notes
This does not happen with the new editor

h3. Workaround
* Select different text to be the target of the comment. Adding at least one word that is not in an "expand macro title" will avoid triggering this bug.
* Adjust the title of the Expand Macro so that it is different from the text being selected for the comment.
fields.summary: Adding Inline comments on a text equal to a title in an expand macro does not work on the Legacy Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a JSD user attempts to access a Confluence KB article linked to a JSD project directly the images on the page fail to load as the permissions against the media API fail and result ina 403.
h3. Environment

Cloud
 Confluence space linked to JSD project as KB.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD project.
 # Create a Confluence space.
 # Link the Confluence space to the JSD project as a KB.
 # Edit space permissions so JSD users have read access to the space.
 # Create a page with images in the Confluence KB space.
 # Create a category for KB articles in JSD project and add the page with images to the category so it can be easily accessed via the portal.
 # Create a user who only has a JSD license.
 # Login as the JSD user and view the page with images via both the customer portal and the page directly via Confluence.

h3. Expected Results

The page loads correctly in both the portal view and Confluence.
  
h3. Actual Results

The page loads correctly in the portal view, however, the images will not load when the pages are accessed directly via Confluence.
||JSD Portal||Confluence||
|!Screenshot 2019-10-18 at 14.51.00.png|width=318,height=406!|!Screenshot 2019-10-18 at 14.51.06.png|width=362,height=399!|

The below exception is thrown in the network tab of the browser dev tools:
{noformat}
{statusCode: 403, data: {authorized: false, valid: false,…},…}
data: {authorized: false, valid: false,…}
authorized: false
errors: [{message: {translation: "Not permitted to access media service configuration data.", args: []}}]
0: {message: {translation: "Not permitted to access media service configuration data.", args: []}}
successful: false
valid: false
message: "com.atlassian.confluence.api.service.exceptions.PermissionException: Not permitted to access media service configuration data."
statusCode: 403{noformat}
 
h3. Workaround

Access the desired pages via the JSD customer portal to view images.
fields.summary: Jira service desk users are unable to load view images in Confluence pages that are KB article linked to JSD project when the confluence page is accessed directly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 

See `JsonPropertyPermissionDelegate : canCreate()`, there is a TODO comment. Passing in `Permission.Edit` into this function is incorrect in certain use cases. For example, an anonymous user has permission to create a comment, but does not have permission to edit a comment. This function should check for hasCreatePermission instead.  

 
h3. Workaround

The current workaround for anonymous users creating comments is to check if the `container` passed in is an instance of a Comment, and check for `hasCreatePermission` accordingly. No workarounds for other possible bugs.
fields.summary: Fix permissions logic in JsonPropertyPermissionDelegate in Confluence Cloud monolith

fields.description:
The current behavior of "Revert to last published version" button does not inform the user that others have made edits to the page. See Image:

  !Screenshot 2019-10-17 at 10.39.07.png|thumbnail! 

Can this be updated to show what other users made changes or changes were made by multiple users since the last published version?
fields.summary: Collaborative Editing should inform users that others made changes after "Revert to last published version" is selected

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing the issue from Jira, in some case there's a delay in parsing javascript resources from Jira frontend and Cloudfront.
h3. Environment

New and old issue view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to an Issue and load the issue
 # From the har file we could notice some slowness when javascript resources loaded from the frontend and CloudFront.

h3. Expected Results

Navigating to an issue should render quickly by optimizing the javascript resource loaded from the frontend and CloudFront and should be consistent as that page is being cached.
h3. Actual Results

Opening an issue tends to be slow, in some case it might take from *10 seconds* or *> 10 second* for a page that already caches from the browser during a hard reload and cacheless reload.
h3. Notes

Due to the slowness in rendering the Javascript resources from frontend/CloudFront, the slowness is actually the same across the issue view (new and old). In most case, here we could see some latency when the browser retrieving the javascript resources particular from the endpoint below:
 * [https://jira-frontend-prod-eu-2.eu-central-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/]
 * [https://cloudfront.net|/]

So in this situation, the On load event can jump to 9.82 seconds to load a page with 21.1MB which is not really optimal in this case since the time to retrieve the javascript prolonged and this caused some latency from the frontend/CloudFront in parsing resources and the time primarily spent in downloading and parsing JS resources.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Slowness in parsing JS resource from Jira frontend and Cloudfront

fields.description:
Currently, when you export documents it looks awful. 

We still have to double handle all of our requirements for this reason using Google Docs and Confluence. 

Would be great to see a more polished export option, with simple styling options.
fields.summary: Improve formatting of exported documents

fields.description:
We would like to be able to share access to specific Confluence pages with a URL only. 

Access would provide commenting access.
fields.summary: Share a specific page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some users face issues when editing pages on Chrome browser. The root cause was an issue in Chrome version 77.0.3865.90 (see [https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1006243]) that caused WebSocket failures after a page have been open in edit mode for a while.
h3. Environment

Affects only certain Chrome browser versions
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Confluence in Chrome Browser version  77.0.3865.90
 # Attempt to edit any page 
 # Leave at edit mode for a while

h3. Expected Results

Edit should continue as per normal
h3. Actual Results

You will unable to proceed with editting the page and you may seen error similar to below at the console logs of the browser. 
{code:java}
"WebSocket connection to 'wss:xxxxx' failed: Unknown reason{code}
h3. Workaround

We can confirm that the latest browser version do not face this issue, so please go ahead and update the browser to a more current version.
fields.summary: Editing pages on certain versions on Chrome browser fails with Websocket error

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload a sample pdf file(shared within Atlassian) to Confluence page
 # Click the preview

h3. Expected Results
The contents of the pdf file is loaded

h3. Actual Results
Only the single-byte characters are rendered

Checking the browser console, the following is returning 404
{code}
_/download/resources/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-previews:mediaviewer-chunks/nullAdobe-Japan1-UCS2.bcmap
{code}

h3. Workaround
* Download the pdf
* This happens with certain pdf files only. Try recreating the pdf
fields.summary: PDF preview does not render multi-byte characters

fields.description:
Hit plus button, filter for "proj" in list, select "project poster", hit back.

After reselecting project poster, the next button doesn't appear to do anything. other templates show a "create" button, but the "project poster" template still has "next".

Closing and reopening the create dialog doesn't appear to change this behavior.
fields.summary: After pressing "back" after starting a create from a "project poster" template, the "next" button doesn't work

fields.description: TinyMCE used to have the ability add borders and taped edges. This suggestion would bring those options to the new editor.
fields.summary: Image Effects (Borders, Taped Edges)

fields.description:
When attempting to create a group in the administration (admin.atlassian), the received message is "A group with this name already exists", even though it has the same name as the reserved system [groups|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/create-and-update-groups-744721627.html].
{quote}There are two default groups that are used by Atlassian support staff. You can't edit these groups or add users to them:

confluence-administrators
 system-administrators
{quote}
We would like to suggest the improvement of the error message to something like "This is a system group name" or "Error: Reserved system group name", or any other error message that makes it clearer than the generic message for all groups.

It can help avoid confusion when creating groups, as those groups are not visible in the administration's instance.
fields.summary: Improve the error message when creating reserved system groups

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Page Properties macro that contains 20-30 items to display with pagination will completely load after 15-20 secs. 

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add Page Properties Macro Report to a page (set the number of items to display to 30)
# Add Page Properties Macro to 40 pages (with JIRA Issue Macro to the Value)

h3. Expected Results
Loading the page with Page Properties Report macro with pagination will load within an acceptable time and the user won't experience a delay in rendering the macro.

h3. Actual Results
Page Properties Report Macro with pagination is loading slow when a Page Properties includes JIRA Issue Macro value
 
h3. Workaround
Change the display item to less than 10.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report Macro with pagination is loading slow when a Page Properties includes JIRA Issue Macro value

fields.description:
In Confluence, the users can include the [Create from template macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/create-from-template-macro-724765187.html] in order to allow people to create a page with a specific template in a space by tapping it. One of the configurations for this macro is to select a specific space (if blank, the current space will be selected), but, in this option, there is no option to have a user creating a page in their own personal space.

This is a suggestion to have an option to create a page in the user's personal space. For example, instead of the space name, a "self personal space" value in which would allow different users to use the same button in order to create a page in their personal spaces.
fields.summary: Self personal space option in Create from Template macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence cannot render page with [HTML macro|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1212279/html-macro-for-confluence-cloud?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] with huge content. Works if page is TinyMCE based, does not work when it is Fabric based. If reduce content size of the macro, Fabric page renders fine. Seems like size of content (or effort to render) is relevant.

h3. How to Replicate

Already replicated. See the pages in https://nghuraiya.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/PUB/overview

h3. Investigation Done

 * Tried to edit the page. Unable to edit nor save (probably due to large content size)

h3. Please Help With

 * Helping customer to get the macro loaded in Fabric (with full content)
 * Diagnose and fix why large content in HTML macro does not work

h3. Workaround

No workaround available except reducing the content. User can no longer create TinyMCE pages.
fields.summary: [DoS] HTML macro with huge content does not load in Fabric

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This is a very specific issue, so please, make sure to read all the description.

When we export a space that has pages on the new editor, containing Gliffy/Draw.io diagrams, from an instance that has both editing experiences to an instance that has only the new editor, the diagrams get broken with a 404 error.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On the instance with both editing experiences (instance *A*), create a page using the new editor on a space and add a Gliffy/Draw.io diagram;
 # After publishing the page, go to *Space Settings > Content Tools > Export* and export the page we created to XML;
 # On the instance with the new editing experience (instance *B*), go to *Settings > Import Spaces* and upload the .zip file from *A*;
 # After importing the space to *B*, access the page we added the diagram.

h3. Expected Results

The diagrams are shown on the imported page.
h3. Actual Results

The diagrams get broken, showing a 404 error.
h3. Notes
 * According to the information we have from the Draw.io support team, it seems that there is a call failing, which is the *{{APgetLocation()}}*
{code:java}
om.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-plugin:ap-navigator-v5.js?externals=_local-default_:33 no context function defined
getLocation @ com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-plugin:ap-navigator-v5.js?externals=_local-default_:33
b.handleRequest @ com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-plugin:ap-core-v5.js?externals=local-default_:52
c.receiveMessage @ com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-plugin:ap-core-v5.js?externals=local-default_:65
com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-plugin:ap-navigator-v5.js?externals=_local-default_:33 no context function defined
getLocation @ com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-plugin:ap-navigator-v5.js?externals=_local-default_:33
b.handleRequest @ com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-plugin:ap-core-v5.js?externals=local-default_:52
c.receiveMessage @ com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-plugin:ap-core-v5.js?externals=local-default_:65
com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-plugin:ap-extensions-v5.js?externals=_local-default_:64 Refused to get unsafe header "ETag"
(anonymous) @ com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-plugin:ap-extensions-v5.js?externals=_local-default_:64
q @ com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-plugin:ap-extensions-v5.js?externals=_local-default_:64
f.onload @ com.atlassian.plugins.atlassian-connect-plugin:ap-extensions-v5.js?externals=_local-default_:68
load (async){code}

 * If we do the same steps, but adding the diagram on a page with the old editing experience, it the imported page shows the diagram fine on the instance *B*

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Gliffy/Draw.io diagrams get broken when importing a space from another instance

fields.description:
When publishing a page, customers can only see the date this version was published. It would be nice to show this complete timestamp.

For now, customers can only access the most 5 recent changes timestamp.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, viewing pages in Mobile browser is not responsive and it will give you a navigation bar at the bottom to be able to view the full content.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be better if viewing page using Mobile browser is responsive instead of having to scroll horizontally. This would be easier for users to read the content of pages.

h3. Workaround
Use the [Confluence Cloud Mobile App|https://www.atlassian.com/software/confluence/mobile-app].
fields.summary: Viewing pages in Mobile Browser should be responsive

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when installing an add-on and the application doesn't have a default group. Add-on installation will fail with an error.
{code}
We ran into a little trouble
It might just be a hiccup. Try again in a bit. 
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide meaningful error of why the add-on installation is failing because of missing default group.
fields.summary: Helpful error when trying to install an add-on and application doesn't have default group

fields.description:
Confluence needs to create an audit trail for administrative changes, for instance, changing site-access. In particular, it is important to create an audit trail for all event types where Global Settings are changed.

It does capture a few such as changing the landing page for the application, attachment max size, retention period, locale.

Presently it's of major inconvenience when that piece of information is lacking. Currently, in Cloud Confluence, a bad actor with relevant access can flick a switch onsite access and give the whole internet access to the cloud confluence instance. We will never know who did it as presently these changes aren't tracked and it has major security implications.
fields.summary: Global Administration audit trail

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attempting to share a Blog tree link from a public space, it receives an error instead of being directed to the webpage.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Make Space Public
 * Share the blog post tree link
 * https://<YOURSITE>.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/<SPACE KEY>/blog

h3. Expected Results

Blog Tree should display without any issue, displaying all the blog post.
h3. Actual Results

Error Screenshot Attached
h3. Workaround

Directly Sharing the link to a Blog page resolves.
fields.summary: Sharing Blog tree link in Confluence results in error

fields.description:
With the [editing improvements of Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], when creating a blank page, it will be a center-aligned page. To change this option, the user must access the *profile picture > Settings >Editor* and then, tap *make page full-width* so all brand new blank pages will be using this option.

As this is a change that is applied only for individual profiles, this is a suggestion to have a global configuration to have new blank pages using full-width as well, instead of only center-aligned.
fields.summary: Global option for full-width blank pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The inline comments/create issue button does not show/is not available in pages that contains the filter results macro on it.
h3. Environment
 * Fabric Editor
 * Tiny Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page or open an existing one and edit it
 # Insert any text
 # Insert the filter results macro
 # Highlight any word or the text and add an inline comment

h3. Expected Results

The inline comment button should be visible and you should be able to add comments.
h3. Actual Results

It is not possible to add inline comments both on tiny and fabric editor.
h3. Notes

In the fabric editor, the create issue button appears.
h3. Workaround

Remove the macro from the page and use a Jira issue macro instead of the filter results macro.
fields.summary: Unable to add inline comments if the page contains filter results macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The attachments macro is no longer prompting to download the image files when we click over them.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* Both Editing Experiences

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page;
# Insert an *Attachments* macro;
# Publish the page;
# Insert an image file using the macro;
# After the image gets uploaded, click over the image name.

h3. Expected Results
The browser prompts a download box.

h3. Actual Results
You are redirected to the image location.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Attachments macro: image files are not downloadable when we click over their names

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the new editor, hyperlinks to the GitHub site don't work if you do not hit enter after inserting the text to be displayed - like clicking out from the link box, for example.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* New Editing Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page;
# Insert  GitHub link - like this one, for example: https://github.com/griddb/griddb_nosql/issues/159
# Click over the link and select the *Edit Link* option;
# Insert a text to be displayed as this link and click out from the link macro.

h3. Expected Results
The text you typed becomes a hyperlink to the GitHub site.

h3. Actual Results
The hyperlink stays as the URL only.

h3. Notes
* It only happens for instances where the new editing experience is fully enabled;
* It is reproducible by clicking over the link option (the chain icon from the toolbar).

h3. Workaround
Instead of clicking out from the text box, hit the *enter* keyboard key.
fields.summary: GitHub links don't allow you to create a hyperlink if you do not hit enter after inserting the text to display

fields.description: Currently, there is no way for the Site-Admins to know when a new space is created, so it would be useful if notification is being to all the Admins on an instance when a new space is created, rather than checking manually and revoking the permissions.
fields.summary: Allow Notification when a new space is created

fields.description:
h4. Summary
There's a dialogue that pops up when users move pages to reorder them in the Confluence Cloud sidebar:

 !Screenshot 2019-10-11 at 14.55.16.png|thumbnail! 

This dialogue will often block the bottom of the page tree, so users have to wait until it dismisses itself, or close the dialogue themselves.

This message takes roughly 8-9 seconds before it dismisses itself.

Update: As of today, 17 December 2021, the dialog no longer dismisses itself in my tests, blocking the page tree.

h4. Solution
Shorten the time it takes to dismiss the message, allow admins to modify this time, or change the location of the message. If a user is moving a lot of pages around, this could hinder their workflow.

h4. Workaround
Perform the change from *Space Settings > Content Tools > Reorder Pages*
fields.summary: Moved page dialogue does not dismiss itself in a timely manner

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Usually, when renaming a space, the overview/ home page will be renamed as well on the Space Settings, but this won't happen if the space has any category (teams, knowledge base, etc.)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a team space (or any other space blueprint besides the blank one)
# Rename the space

h3. Expected Results
The home page should be renamed as well, as it happens with a blank space

h3. Actual Results
Home page is not renamed


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Renaming a space with categories won't rename the home page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new editing experience, if a page has a double/triple column filled with content, if the user tries to export this page to PDF, the content will be cut on the left side.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Confluence, make sure to create a brand new page.
 # In this page, add columns/layouts and make sure to fill them with text
 # Add an additional header or text in the page, but, outside of the columns

h3. Expected Results

The PDF should be properly exported, reflecting the page content.
h3. Actual Results

The page is cut in the left side, as seen in the attachment below:

[^140346055-90767362-101019-2130 (1).pdf]
h3. Workaround

Export to Word and save as pdf
fields.summary: Exporting a page with columns to PDF will cut the left side of the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While in collaborative mode, when the user tries to select the same word that a second editor in the same page has already highlighted, with a double click, instead of selecting the word, it selects the entire line instead and the word is not selected at all.
h3. Environment
Fabric

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any page and try to edit it with someone else (or open two tabs of the same page in edit mode) in Safari browser
 # Pick any word in the text and highlight it/select;
 # With the second edit page open, try to select/highlight the same word with a double click
 

h3. Expected Results
You are able to select the word by double clicking
h3. Actual Results
Not able to select the word by double clicking, it highlights/select the whole line instead, but not the word desired.

h3. Notes
Test done on Safari, Chrome and Firefox. Bug only happens in Safari.
Behavior does not happen when editing page alone.

h3. Workaround
As working as expected in Chrome, change browser.
fields.summary: Not able to select a word with double click on Collaborative edit if the same is selected by other editor in the same page using Safari

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While in collaborative mode, when the user tries to select the same word that a second editor in the same page has already highlighted, with a double click, instead of selecting the word, it selects the entire line instead.

h3. Environment
Fabric

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any page and try to edit it with someone else (or open two tabs of the same page in edit mode) in firefox browser
 # Pick any word in the text and highlight it/select;

h3. Expected Results

Behavior does not happen when editing page alone.

fields.summary: Not able to select a word with double click on Collaborative edit if the same is selected by other editor in the same page using Firefox

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While in collaborative editing, when the user tries to type in an action item in firefox, if the a second editor is in the same action item, the cursor vanishes for the first editor and it is no longer possible to type. However if the first editor attempts to type in a part of some text in the action item, before the collaborative icon from the second editor in the page, he is able to type.
 The bug happens when the first editor is trying to type after the collaborative icon is on, the cursor vanishes.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any page and try to edit it with someone else (or open two tabs of the same page in edit mode) in firefox browser
 # Insert an action item and click outside the action item
 # With the second edit page open, click on the action item to put the collaborative edit icon there
 # Go back to the first edit page and click on the action item right after the collaborative edit icon from the second editor
 # Type any text

h3. Expected Results

You are able to keep editing and typing any text after the collaborative edit icon in firefox.
h3. Actual Results

Not able to type any text after the collaborative edit icon and the cursor vanishes after clicking in the action item, if you are using firefox.
h3. Notes

Test made in firefox version 69.0.1 and 69.0.2 (last updated version)
When the first editor using firefox tries to click after the collaborative edit icon in the action item, if there is any text there already, after several clicks, the texts selects, but still unable to type any text.
 Same issue happens in the decision macro and all panels (info, error, note, success and warning).
h3. Workaround

As working as expected in Chrome, change browser.
fields.summary: Not able to type in action item while on Collaborative edit using Firefox

fields.description:

In new editor If you select text lines with the links then we will not be able to use bullet/numbered list but when we select only text with multiple lines it will work without any issue, it unable to apply Bullet and number format on links.

Confluence cloud

Note: It is working fine in old editor.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user starts editing a draft while online and then goes offline, going back online and clicking the close button loses all draft content.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # While connected to an active internet, create a new page
 # While on the editor, enter device into offline mode (disable WiFi or LAN connection)
 # Enter any words on the page while offline.
 # Switch to an active connection and click "Close"

h3. Expected Results

The offline draft content is saved
h3. Actual Results

The offline draft is lost
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When editing a draft offline connecting to the internet and clicking the close button loses draft content

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When sharing a page to a group (not a team), the members of that group won't receive the e-mail notification.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a page
# Click on the *Share* button
# Type a group's name (not a team) and select it
# Click on *Send*

h3. Expected Results
The members of the selected group should receive an e-mail notification, the same way it happens to individual users and teams

h3. Actual Results
Members of the selected group won't be notified.


h3. Workaround
Create a team with the same name as the group and share it with the team. You may create the team with the following steps:

# Go to <sitename>.atlassian.net/people
# Use the *Start a team* button to get started with a team.
# Add the same users from the group into this team
# Share the page with the team
fields.summary: Sharing a page with a group won't send the e-mail notification

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Edit functionality is disabled for certain users for certain customers
h3. Environment

New Editor 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The issue is currently not reproducible. If you are seeing this bug, please comment and let us know if you are also seeing it in Incognito mode. Additionally:

**Please help us reproduce it**:

URLs to test on [https://websocketstest.com]
If the network does not support/allow wss connections, the "WebSockets (Port 443, SSL)" section will be blank. 

h3. Expected Results

Edit functionality should we visible in Confluence for all users
h3. Actual Results

Edit functionality header grayed out for certain customers
h3. Workaround - Known Issue

A customer reporting this issue discovered that their websocket connections was blocked by their proxy set by their IT department. A workaround is to use Firefox with a manual proxy when editing in Confluence.
fields.summary: Edit functions is grayed out in Confluence Cloud for certain users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a Customer Edits a system generated Space Overview Page (that's using the Old Editor) 'quick create' links using the markup "\[New Page Title\]" will not create the new page

h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud where the New Confluence Editor (Fabric) is enabled for creating New Pages

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a New Confluence Site
# Create a New Space
# Edit the Overview Page (that's system generated) and insert Confluence Page using Markup "\[New Page Title\]"
#- The Page Title should be the Title of a New Page and render as a Red Link
# Publish the Overview Page
# Click the Red "Page Title" link

h3. Expected Results
The User is able to create and publish a new page from this link

h3. Actual Results
The Old (TinyMCE) Editor loads and is unable to connect with Synchrony; the Users is unable to publish the page

There is a brief error message, but then the Editor Loads; this message is not seen in Console Logging even with persist logs enabled.

UI Error messages when Editor Loads:
{quote}Unable to communicate with server. Saving is not possible at the moment.{quote}
{quote}*The connection timed out.*
Check you can connect to the internet, then try reloading.  If there's no problem with your connection, speak to your Confluence admin.{quote}

 !image-2019-10-09-13-11-21-165.png|thumbnail! 

Browser Console shows a 401 when trying to connect to the page and to synchrony

h3. Notes

The URLs the Markup creates is:
{code}https://HOSTNAME.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/createpage.action?spaceKey=<KEY>&title=<NewPageTitle>&linkCreation=true&fromPageId=<ParentID>{code}

This URL appears to work in other TinyMCE, non-Overview Pages; the New Pages is created using the New Confluence Editor, but, the Page Title is not populated - similar to Bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-64990

However, this may not be an option in some Cloud Sites where the New Confluence Editor is the only/default option when creating New Pages; the "\[New Page Title\]" does not currently work in Fabric and renders in plain-text.  Feature Request to use "Undefined Page Links" in the New Editor- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-67129

This may not impact older Confluence Cloud Sites which do not yet have the New Confluence Editor

h3. Workaround

Create New Pages using the + button in the Sidebar or Page Tree or use the Create from Template macro
fields.summary: Unable to Create New Pages Using Undefined Page Markup Links in Overview Pages

fields.description:
Reported by macro vendor ...

If a macro parameter includes an equals character (e.g. "a=1"), the value returned from {{AP.confluence.getMacroData()}} is truncated at the equals sign.

This is an issue if (as in our case), we have a macro parameter that accepts a URL, and that URL includes querystring parameters, as those parameter values are not returned.

For example, our app (Open API Documentation for Confluence) allows a content creator to specify a URL where their API definition (swagger file) is hosted, e.g.

[https://www.example.com/swagger.json?token=abcde]

When using AP.confluence.getMacroData(), the callback value returned is:

{{{ "url": "https://}}{{[www.example.com/swagger.json?token|http://www.example.com/swagger.json?token]}}{{" } }}

(note that the "=abcde" is stripped from the returned value).

We can reproduce the same bug on an arbitrary "test" parameter with a value of "a=1", which {{AP.confluence.getMacroData()}} returns as

{{{ "test": "a" } }}

instead of

{{{ "test": "a=1" } }}

(Note: Calling the REST API returns the correct values).

This bug means our users are unable to specify URLs in our macro that include a "=" character; which will be a showstopper for us.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: AP.confluence.getMacroData() is truncated if parameter contains equal sign

h3. Issue Summary

If a Jira filter macros is added to the page and a custom *single user picker* field from Jira is included in the results display, this returns the users username value instead of their display name like with the *reporter* and *assignee* fields.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud 
 TinyMC & Fabric editors
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira and Confluence cloud site.
 # In Jira create a customer single user picker field and add this to required screens and scopes.
 # In Jira create a test issue and populate the custom user picker field with a user.
 # Create a page in confluence.
 # Add a Jira filter macro to the Confluence page.
 # Include the customer user picker field in the displayed results in the Jira macro.
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

The value in the custom user picker field within the Jira macro should return the display name for the user.
h3. Actual Results

The value in the custom user picker field within the Jira macro is the username
h3. Notes

This is especially problematic for SCIM provisioned users as they are issues a UUID as the username.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding a Jira filter to a Confluence page which includes a customer Picker field from Jira in the view, displays the Jira username value instead of the display name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When editing text on the new editing experience and we add the *Code* formatting to a word at the end of the sentence, right before a line break, the keyboard shortcut *CMMD + Right Arrow* doesn't work to go to the end of this sentence and brings you to the end of the page.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* New Editing Experience
* Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add some text to your page, letting it scrollable;
# In the middle of your page, add the *Code* formatting (*CMMD + Shift + M*) to the last word of the sentence (make sure there is no space right after this word);
# Put the mouse cursor at the beginning of the sentence and try to use the keyboard shortcut *CMMD + Right Arrow*

h3. Expected Results
The cursor is placed at the end of the sentence.

h3. Actual Results
You are placed at the end of the page.

h3. Notes
* All the CMMD + Arrows seem to work weird on this same case.

h3. Workaround
You can use another browser, like Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox

*OR*

After the word you formatted with the Code style, add a space and it will no longer end as a formatted word, but with an unformatted keyboard character ;)
fields.summary: CMMD + Right Arrow doesn't work correctly on Safari when the end of the sentence has a word in the Code formatting

The bullets/numbers get placed in the left cell from where they were added.

!image-2019-10-09-09-29-20-345.png|width=365,height=205!

Use a different browser, like Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox.

UTF-8</con:encoding><con:endpoint>https://test.atlassian.net/admin/rest/um/1/usermanagement</con:endpoint><con:request><![CDATA[<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the new editor officially supports only specific/ limited markdown codes, as per [Keyboard Shortcuts, Markdown, and Autocomplete - Markdown|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/keyboard-shortcuts-markdown-and-autocomplete-724764956.html#KeyboardShortcuts,Markdown,andAutocomplete-Markdown].
 In some cases, when trying to use the complete list of markdown codes (e.g. [https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet]), it won't present the expected results .

Examples of unsupported markdown (tables):
{code:none}
Colons can be used to align columns.

| Tables        | Are           | Cool  |
| ------------- |:-------------:| -----:|
| col 3 is      | right-aligned | $1600 |
| col 2 is      | centered      |   $12 |
| zebra stripes | are neat      |    $1 |

There must be at least 3 dashes separating each header cell.
The outer pipes (|) are optional, and you don't need to make the 
raw Markdown line up prettily. You can also use inline Markdown.

Markdown | Less | Pretty
--- | --- | ---
*Still* | `renders` | **nicely**
1 | 2 | 3{code}
h3. Suggested Solution

Implement full markdown code support
h3. Workaround

No know workaround for some specific markdown codes other than manually creating the elements on the editor.
fields.summary: Full markdown support for the new editor

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-11194].
  {panel}

Confluence needs to support opening a link in a new window.  

Although I admit that it probably shouldn't use target as that's deprecated, it should still do it (article on standards compliant way: http://www.sitepoint.com/article/standards-compliant-world).

Wordpress does it and I use it all the time.  Within a week of us rolling out Confluence at my company, people have started asking for it.  

I am aware of the CONF-1210, CONF-7045, and CONF-6947 marked "Will not fix," but this is a simple feature found in competing products which users find useful and I wanted to open it again and get votes behind it.

The {link-to} macro doesn't do this for external links so it doesn't satisfy this requirement.

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of September 19, 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA} 
Hi everyone, 

Thank you for your ongoing feedback on this issue. On behalf of the Confluence team I would like to apologize for the changing status of this request. After many hours of discussion with design and product management, and after some engineering prototyping and testing, we have decided to close this issue as we do not plan to release this feature.

We aim to make our users' experience as friction-free as possible, and although being able to control the ways of opening links would be useful to many of you, it could easily lead to an inconsistent experience for users.

If your use of Confluence is in fact enhanced by opening particular links in a new window/tab then please consider using one of the existing solutions from our Marketplace (unfortunately they're not available for Cloud instances): 

* [ServiceRocket Linking Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/net.customware.confluence.plugin.linking]
* [External Link Add-on|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/ch.bitvoodoo.confluence.plugins.externallinks]

Cheers,

Adam Barnes
Confluence Product Manager
{panel}
fields.summary: Open links in new window

Creating Jira Links on Safari presents three different behaviours:

h3. Issue Summary

Attempting to move a page within the editor does not list some spaces based on your search criteria.

This makes it very difficult for a customer to copy a page from another space, or to move your draft page to the desired destination space.
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 *
 *
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View a Confluence page in Hello
_(fabric page made with the new editor)_
 # Copy the page (meatballs --> Copy)
 # Attempt to move the page (meatballs --> "Move page")
 # Type in "Confluence Mission"
 ## *Expected:* It shows a list of spaces including "Confluence Mission Control"
 ## *Actual:* It shows "No matches found"

h3. Notes
 * The CQL query performed in the API call behind the scenes _does_ return this space in the results
 * It might be incorrectly filtering based on permissions. The spaces that do appear in the list are ones that have granted me a higher level of permissions, e.g. "Confluence Cloud Backbone" grants me "administer", "update", "delete" etc. In contrast, the "Confluence Mission Control" space doesn't grant me those permissions, however I do have "create page" permission which should be sufficient to copy a new draft page into that space

h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attempting to sort the results of the Task report macro, The macro re-orders the results, however the results are not actually sorted by assignee. This can result in some tasks assigned to a given assignee being separated by other tasks not assigned to that user.
(see example images below)

In addition, the sort does not provide different results between ascending and Descending sort. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create at least one page with a number of tasks using multiple different users for the tasks and providing a good mix of both tasks with users, without users, with dates, without dates, etc.
 # On another page, create a task report macro to report on the users.
 # Click the "Assignee" header to sort the column
 # if the results appear to be sorted, go back to the page and add more tasks for at least one user that has already been given tasks, then reload the page with the report macro and sort again. You may end up with unsorted results.
 # Next try to reverse the sort by clicking the "Assignee" header to change the sort order.

h3. Expected Results

    The results of the macro are sorted and ordered correctly

h3. Actual Results

The results are not ordered or sorted, though the sorting and ordering is changed in some way that appears to be random but the ordering and sorting is consistent.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround.
fields.summary: Sort by Assignee field in Task report macro does not actually sort the results.
